What is CSE Day?

CSE Day is an event dedicated to the passion and education of all who are interested in CS or CE, and highlights the broadest of opportunities, be it in industry or academia. CSE Day serves an important purpose in the computing community on campus, by showing students what important things they can do in the industry before and after they graduate, helping to demystify the pathways they can take to become successful, and showing them the opportunities that their peers, the faculty and the attending companies can offer them.

Schedule of the Day

11:00-11:50 AM

Faculty Talk

12:00-12:45 PM

Lunch

Come enjoy a delicious lunch served by Subway. It's absolutely FREE!

1:00-2:05 PM

Recruiter Panel

You know all those questions you have about that perfect job you've always wanted? We've got recruiters from Google, Microsoft, Cube and iBoss here. Ask away!

2:15-3:45 PM

CSE Club Showcase

Find out what goes on at UCSD and how you can get more involved in the community. Come see what VGDC, Virtual Reality Club, Data Science Student Society, Women In Computing and the Video Game club have in store for you!

4:00-4:50 PM

Google on Machine Learning

AI and machine learning are on the boom and with one of the world's best Cognitive Science departments at UCSD that works closely with the CSE department you've got no reason to not know more about it.Come find out what the folks at Google have to say about machine learning.

5:00-5:50 PM

Alumni Panel

Have a rigorous Q/A session with UCSD alumni currently working in Facebook, Visa and ViaSat.

6:00-7:00 PM

Industry Dinner

Come to our industry dinner catered by Buca di Beppo. This will give you the opportunity to socialize with the attendees from the industry and the other students. It's a great opportunity to ask about anything that you didn't get from the panels or talks.

7:00-8:00 PM

Jeopardy

The student v/s faculty jeopardy has become a CSE Day tradition over the years and is arguably the most fun part of the event.

The raffle prizes will also be anounced right after Jeopardy.

Venue

Computer Science and Engineering Building, UCSD

Room 1202
